item.description:
We're going back to Manomet Hill and Fire Tower in the Pine Hills. The highest point on the coast between Maine and Georgia is right here in your backyard. The climb up this 400 foot hill offers a good workout and the views are spectacular.

We won't go straight up but this hike is more rigorous than typically seen in Myles Standish State Forest. Â Please wear good boots and bring along plenty of water and or snacks. (It's a baby hill by White Mountain standards but it's still a fairly steep hill.) It takes about an hour to climb. The fire tower isn't on the hilltop but takes another 15 minutes to reach and offers spectacular views. Estimated total hike length-two and a half hours (estimating we stop for about a half an hour on top and at the tower.)

Join us at 7:30 at Metro's Cafe on Route 3A in Manomet for breakfast if you need some extra energy. Their $2.95 breakfast special is a deal. All are welcome to join us.
item.how_to_find_us: The hike starts at the parking lot for the John Alden club, which is close to the intersection of Beaver Dam Road and Route 3A in Plymouth. (There should be a link for a map above.)

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Thursday Hiking Club- Manomet Hill and Fire Tower
